trans-unit.source: Move Data to and from Azure Blob Storage using AzCopy | Microsoft Azure
trans-unit.target: Move Data to and from Azure Blob Storage using AzCopy | Microsoft Azure

trans-unit.source: Move Data to and from Azure Blob Storage using AzCopy
trans-unit.target: Move Data to and from Azure Blob Storage using AzCopy

trans-unit.source: Move Data to and from Azure Blob Storage using AzCopy
trans-unit.target: Move Data to and from Azure Blob Storage using AzCopy

trans-unit.source: Introduction
trans-unit.target: Introduction

trans-unit.source: AzCopy is a command-line utility designed for high-performance uploading, downloading, and copying data to and from Microsoft Azure blob, file, and table storage.
trans-unit.target: AzCopy is a command-line utility designed for high-performance uploading, downloading, and copying data to and from Microsoft Azure blob, file, and table storage.

trans-unit.source: For instructions on installing AzCopy and additional information on using it with the Azure platform, see [Getting Started with the AzCopy Command-Line Utility](../storage-use-azcopy.md).
trans-unit.target: For instructions on installing AzCopy and additional information on using it with the Azure platform, see [Getting Started with the AzCopy Command-Line Utility](../storage-use-azcopy.md).

trans-unit.source: Guidance on technologies used to move data to and/or from Azure Blob storage are linked here:
trans-unit.target: Guidance on technologies used to move data to and/or from Azure Blob storage are linked here:

trans-unit.source: [AZURE.NOTE] If you are using VM that was set up with the scripts provided by [Data Science Virtual machines in Azure](machine-learning-data-science-virtual-machines.md), then AzCopy is already installed on the VM.
trans-unit.target: [AZURE.NOTE] If you are using VM that was set up with the scripts provided by [Data Science Virtual machines in Azure](machine-learning-data-science-virtual-machines.md), then AzCopy is already installed on the VM.

trans-unit.source: [AZURE.NOTE] For a complete introduction to Azure blob storage, please refer to [Azure Blob Basics](../storage-dotnet-how-to-use-blobs.md) and [Azure Blob Service](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/azure/dd179376.aspx).
trans-unit.target: [AZURE.NOTE] For a complete introduction to Azure blob storage, please refer to [Azure Blob Basics](../storage-dotnet-how-to-use-blobs.md) and [Azure Blob Service](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/azure/dd179376.aspx).

trans-unit.source: Prerequisites
trans-unit.target: Prerequisites

trans-unit.source: This document assumes that you have an Azure subscription, a storage account and the corresponding storage key for that account.
trans-unit.target: This document assumes that you have an Azure subscription, a storage account and the corresponding storage key for that account.

trans-unit.source: Before uploading/downloading data, you must know your Azure storage account name and account key.
trans-unit.target: Before uploading/downloading data, you must know your Azure storage account name and account key.

trans-unit.source: To set up an Azure subscription, see [Free one-month trial](https://azure.microsoft.com/pricing/free-trial/).
trans-unit.target: To set up an Azure subscription, see [Free one-month trial](https://azure.microsoft.com/pricing/free-trial/).

trans-unit.source: For instructions on creating a storage account and for getting account and key information, see [About Azure storage accounts](../storage-create-storage-account.md).
trans-unit.target: For instructions on creating a storage account and for getting account and key information, see [About Azure storage accounts](../storage-create-storage-account.md).

trans-unit.target: Upload files to an Azure blob

trans-unit.target: To upload a file, use the following command in the AzCopy is a command-line.

trans-unit.target: Download files from an Azure blob

trans-unit.source: To download a file from an Azure blob, use the following command in the AzCopy is a command-line.
trans-unit.target: To download a file from an Azure blob, use the following command in the AzCopy is a command-line.

trans-unit.target: Transfer blobs between Azure containers

trans-unit.target: To transfer blobs between Azure containers, use the following command in the AzCopy is a command-line.

trans-unit.source: Tips for using AzCopy
trans-unit.target: Tips for using AzCopy

trans-unit.source: When uploading files, /S will upload files recursively.
trans-unit.target: When uploading files, /S will upload files recursively.

trans-unit.source: Without this parameter, any files in the subdirectory will not be uploaded.
trans-unit.target: Without this parameter, any files in the subdirectory will not be uploaded.

trans-unit.source: When downloading file, /S will search the container recursively until all files in the specified directory and its subdirectories or all files that matching the specified pattern in the given directory and its subdirectories, are downloaded.
trans-unit.target: When downloading file, /S will search the container recursively until all files in the specified directory and its subdirectories or all files that matching the specified pattern in the given directory and its subdirectories, are downloaded.

trans-unit.source: You cannot specify a specific blob file to download using the /Source parameter.
trans-unit.target: You cannot specify a specific blob file to download using the /Source parameter.

trans-unit.source: To download a specific file, specify the blob file name to download using the /Pattern parameter.
trans-unit.target: To download a specific file, specify the blob file name to download using the /Pattern parameter.

trans-unit.source: /S parameter can be used to have AzCopy look for a file name pattern recursively.
trans-unit.target: /S parameter can be used to have AzCopy look for a file name pattern recursively.

trans-unit.source: Without the pattern parameter, AzCopy will download all files in that directory.
trans-unit.target: Without the pattern parameter, AzCopy will download all files in that directory.
